name: The Leftovers Quiz | Food & Drink | 10 Questions

questions.text: What can you add to spaghetti to make Spaghetti Frittata?
questions.explanation:
Eggs.

	Did you make too much spaghetti last night? Add some eggs, and a few other ingredients and turn it into a Spaghetti Frittata. The ingredients are: 8 ounces uncooked whole-wheat spaghetti, or 4 cups cooked, extra-virgin olive oil, chopped onions, eggs, nonfat milk, freshly grated Parmesan cheese, chopped fresh parsley, chopped fresh basil, freshly ground pepper and optionally a diced tomato. Just cook the spaghetti (or use leftovers) and then mix the rest together in a bowl, add the spaghetti and cook on high until done.

questions.text: If you have some leftover pasta, any variety really, just add it to a stir fry! What are the best things from the list to add to a traditional stir fry?
options: Anything with a high sugar content
questions.explanation:
Vegetables.

	Stir fries are traditionally some type of meat or pasta and lots of veggies. Take the leftover pasta, toss it in a large pan with whatever veggies you have laying around and fry in some type of oil until the veggies are cooked. Instead stir fry!

questions.text: What product would best be used to make croutons?
questions.explanation:
Day-old French bread.

	Day-old French bread is perfect for crouton making, especially if it was left in the air to get stale. Simply cut up the bread into small cubes, and add the seasonings that you want on your croutons and it's a perfect home-made crouton. Toss those croutons on a salad or in an onion soup for added leftover goodness!

questions.text: What to do with that leftover cheese? Simple, slap in on some bread and call it a ________
questions.explanation:
Sandwich.

	It's too simple to think of, but with extra cheese left over from any event or meal, just put it on some bread, heat and make a grilled cheese sandwich. Easy Peasy. If you have pasta laying around, you could also make macaroni and cheese with the leftovers. Cheese is very versatile.

questions.text: Last night's party was a success, but man there is a lot of pizza left. What dish (among those listed) could I most easily make?
questions.explanation:
Breakfast casserole.

	The casserole only needs about 5-10 minutes of prep time and then to be tossed in the oven. Arrange pizza squares in a prepared baking dish. Mix eggs, milk, mozzarella cheese, onion, butter, garlic, oregano, and salt together in a large bowl; pour over pizza pieces. Pop it in the over for about 30 minutes. The other three dishes require massively changing the pizza into something different, and then cooking with it again.

questions.text: Hmm, I have leftover rice and chicken. Using only water and some spices what can I make?
questions.explanation:
Soup.

	Among the options provided, chicken soup is the easiest of the dishes to prepare, and the only that can be gotten to with just water and spices on top of those leftover ingredients. Bring the water to a boil, add in the chicken, rice and spices and it's basically done since everything was already cooked previously.

questions.text: After making several dishes that call for egg yolks, I've got a lot of egg whites left, what can I make quickly, other than a mess?
options: Nothing calls for just egg whites
questions.explanation:
Egg Drop Soup.

	Egg Drop Soup is simple to make. Just put water, and various spices in the pan and heat. Once up to temperature, slowly drip in egg whites. Enjoy! Recipes vary, but that's the basics.

questions.text: It's not a dessert, but instead a way to use up my leftover turkey from Thanksgiving. What dish am I planning to make?
questions.explanation:
Pot pie.

	I've never even heard of a turkey turnover, the other two options are desserts. A pot pie though is a nice crust filled with dinner fixings instead of the more traditional "pie" fillings. They are perfect for turkey, gravy and some veggies.

questions.text: Pork chops can be added to spaghetti leftovers to make a tasty new dish.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It might not sound great at first, especially to a picky eater. But anyone who likes both spaghetti and pork chops can use leftover chops to make the meatsauce for a spaghetti dish. I first tried this dish when I was about 13 and have had it every few months since. Literally just substitute the pork chops (cut into strips or cubes) for the more traditional hamburger or sausage.

questions.text: Let's make a tasty dessert. With no added ingredients, what can I make my bananas into before they go bad?
questions.explanation:
Ice cream.

	While bananas can be used to make all of them, banana ice cream is the only one that requires no extra ingredients.  Simply grind up the bananas with a blender, and freeze them. After a couple of hours they are the perfect healthy treat to enjoy.
